title: If Prez remains silent, massive TU action will convert into a massive people’s struggle: TUCC
body_lines: Another massive trade union action to be launched tomorrow (13) in front of the Presidential Secretariat calling on President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to resign, the Trade Union Coordination Centre (TUCC) convenor Wasantha Samarasinghe said.

He told the media that their countrywide trade union action was called off yesterday following the resignation of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa from the post on Monday and considering the current situation the country is facing.
Samarasinghe requested the President to resign from the post immediately without wasting any time.

"Several political movements in this country have presented their programs to commence the restoration process of the country. Therefore, the country should go for any kind of solution. "The country should not go astray anymore," he said.
Therefore, we have decided to launch a massive trade union action tomorrow at 2.00 p.m in front of the Presidential Secretariat, he said.
If the President does not resign and remain silent, we will convert this massive trade union action into a massive people's struggle, Samarasinghe added. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
